thread.title: Top tips for freeing up space around the house
thread.title_full: Top tips for freeing up space around the house - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Top tips for freeing up space around the house
text: Discover more energy saving tips » Free up space previously occupied by CDs and records by signing up to a music-streaming service for a monthly fee, such as Spotify, Apple Music or Tidal. The Google Photos app is a convenient way to save all your photos digitally in one place. Download free from the App Store or Google Play. Get rid of cumbersome external hard drives and save large files, documents and hundreds of music tracks in the Cloud-based file-hosting service Dropbox. Switch to paperless utility bills and bank statements, allowing you to check your accounts easily online without endless letters cluttering up your doormat. If you’re an iPhone or Mac user, you can easily share ebooks, music, downloaded TV programmes and films through free Family Sharing, which you can download to your own device at any time. Dust off your bookshelves and use your Kindle, Kobo or Sony ereader or tablet to read digital page-turners that take up a fraction of the space. Swap your space-consuming desktop computer for a sleeker, faster laptop, notebook or tablet for work tasks and catching up with television on the go. Make yourself some cash as a reward for the decluttering process and sell anything that you no longer want or need through eBay, Gumtree or Amazon. • Learn about smart meters and find out how you can save money and time to spend on the things you love.
